senses.sense_definition: To remove the crown or royal authority from a monarch.

examples.text: The rebels conspired to <w>decrown</w> the king and establish a new government.
In the play, the tragic hero is forced to <w>decrown</w> himself before his enemies.

senses.sense_definition: To strip someone or something of high status, supremacy, or dignity.

examples.text: New scientific evidence can sometimes <w>decrown</w> long-held theories.
The scandal served to <w>decrown</w> the politician of his moral authority.

senses.sense_definition: To cut off the leafy top part of a fruit, such as a pineapple or strawberry.

examples.text: You should <w>decrown</w> the pineapple carefully before slicing the fruit.
The chef taught the students how to <w>decrown</w> strawberries efficiently.

senses.sense_definition: To surgically remove the crown portion of a tooth.

examples.text: The dentist decided to <w>decrown</w> the tooth to preserve the healthy root.
In some cases, it is safer to <w>decrown</w> the molar than to extract it completely.
